titleStmt.title: The humble petition of all the inhabitants of the town of Old Braintford, to the Honourable the Commons assembled in Parliament, for some speedy course for reliefe of such great damage and losse as they received by his Majesties forces of the twelfth and thirteenth of this present November. Together with an order for the ministers of Middlesex, and partly of London, to reade in their parish churches on the next fast day the relation of the sufferings of the inhabitants of old Braintford lately printed for Ed. Husbands and Jo. Frank, and to excite the people to a compassionate consideration of them. Ordered, that this petition and order be forthwith printed and published. H. Elsynge, Cler. Parl. D. Com.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Edward Husbands and John Frank,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
